description: Example request for building Two Sum solution

input.problem: Given an array of integers nums and an integer target, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target. You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice.

expectedOutput.pattern: Hash Map / Dictionary pattern. Store complements while iterating.
expectedOutput.stepByStep:
Step 1: Create empty dictionary to store seen numbers
Step 2: Loop through array with index and value
Step 3: Calculate complement = target - current number
Step 4: Check if complement exists in dictionary
Step 5: If yes, return [dict[complement], current index]
Step 6: If no, store current number with its index
Step 7: Continue to next element
expectedOutput.complexity:
Time: O(n) - single pass through array
Space: O(n) - hash map stores up to n elements

chatResponse: Two Sum solution is ready! The AlgoTutor panel shows the hash map approach with minimal code, step-by-step logic, and a dry-run.
